title: He watched the Koons 'balloon dog' fall and shatter...and wants to buy the remains
description: Artist and collector Stephen Gamson was pointing out the porcelain balloon dog to his friend when the whole thing went down. It seems one gallery's trash is another man's treasure.

title: Pregnant Russians flock to Argentina, seeking passports — and options — for their kids
description: The navy blue booklets, available to anyone born there, allow entry to 171 countries without a visa. It's a backup plan that well-off Russians believe may come in handy in the ever-uncertain future.

title: This selfie above China's balloon was taken over Missouri. Here's how we know that
description: The photo from aboard the Air Force's legendary U-2 spy plane shows the Chinese balloon. But where, exactly, was it taken? It's actually possible to answer that question using clues from the image.

title: Harvey Weinstein sentenced to 16 more years in prison in Los Angeles
description: Once one of the most powerful men in Hollywood, the 70-year-old former film producer will most likely spend the rest of his life in prison. He is already serving a 23-year sentence in New York.

title: Senators are calling on the Justice Department to look into Ticketmaster's practices
description: The leaders of the Senate subcommittee that held a hearing into Ticketmaster last month shared evidence with the Justice Department and asked it to "continue examining" the company's conduct.

title: A million households have lost power so far as major winter storm blasts the U.S.
description: A major winter storm is continuing to bring heavy snow, blizzard conditions and significant ice from California to the Northeast on Thursday.

title: R. Kelly sentenced to one more year in prison for child pornography
description: The disgraced former R&B star is already serving 30 years for sex trafficking and racketeering. On Thursday, he was given one more year in prison for having made pornography with three children.

title: How a former caterer created the mercenary army fighting Putin's war in Ukraine
description: Guardian journalist Shaun Walker talks about Yevgeny Prigozhin, the tough-talking convict-turned-businessman who recruits soldiers from Russian prisons to fight in Ukraine.

title: Jimmy Carter took on the awful Guinea worm when no one else would — and he triumphed
description: Carter targeted diseases primarily affecting the poor in remote areas — notably "Guinea worm disease." Because of his commitment, case numbers plummeted from 3.6 million a year to just 13 in 2022.

title: Here's the most thorough explanation yet for the train derailment in East Palestine
description: A wheel bearing on the train's 23rd car overheated to a dangerous degree, a new NTSB report says. Soon after, dozens of cars — including 11 carrying toxic chemicals — derailed near the Ohio town.

title: The number of mothers who die due to pregnancy or childbirth is 'unacceptable'
description: That's what epidemiologist Jenny Cresswell of the World Health Organization said of death rate data in a new report she authored — "equivalent to almost 800 deaths a day or a death every 2 minutes."

title: Alex Murdaugh takes the stand to testify in his murder trial
description: It's the latest dramatic shift in a case that has drawn attention because of the Murdaugh family's status as a wealthy and prominent family. Watch the testimony live.

title: WATCH: Alex Murdaugh takes the stand to testify in his murder trial
description: Murdaugh admitted on the stand that he lied about his alibi but said he did not kill his wife and son. It's the latest dramatic shift in a case involving the wealthy, prominent family. Watch live.

title: Dylan Lyons, a 24-year-old TV journalist, was killed while reporting on a shooting
description: Spectrum News 13 confirmed that 24-year-old reporter Dylan Lyons was killed while covering a shooting on Wednesday, along with a 9-year-old girl. Her mom and a station photojournalist were injured.

title: Many U.K. grocers limit some fruit and veggie sales as extreme weather impacts supply
description: Grocery giants including Tesco, Asda, Aldi and Morrisons are struggling with their supply chains, particularly with products sourced from Spain and Morocco where extreme weather has damaged crops.

title: Putinology: the art of analyzing the man in the Kremlin
description: They used to be called Kremlinologists — American experts on the Soviet Union. Now there's a new generation of Putinologists who seek to interpret Russia by analyzing its authoritarian leader.

title: Deaths in custody are a crisis, but data on them is a black hole, a new report says
description: A new report indicates that the federal government severely undercounts people who died while being transported, detained or arrested by law enforcement and those who died while incarcerated.

title: After the Ukraine war, what comes next? NATO allies don't agree
description: The military alliance is publicly committed to preserving Ukraine's independence. But discussions on how to reach that goal are quietly contentious.

title: Red and blue states look to Medicaid to improve the health of people leaving prison
description: People leaving jail or prison are at extremely high risk of hospitalization and death, and policymakers from deep blue California to solidly red Utah think bringing Medicaid behind bars could help.

title: Americans want Congress to deal with the debt ceiling. How to do it is complicated
description: A slim majority of respondents in the latest NPR/PBS NewsHour/Marist poll say the debt ceiling should be raised. But they split on whether to cut programs or raise taxes to reduce the national debt.

title: A West Virginia bill allowing concealed guns at colleges is one step away from law
description: A bill that would allow concealed weapons to be carried on West Virginia college campuses passed by a landslide in the state's House of Delegates. It heads to the desk of Republican Gov. Jim Justice.

title: She's Ukrainian-American. Her relatives are in Russia. Family group texts are awkward
description: For people who have family members on different sides of the war in Ukraine, it's been a long year of disagreeing, disbelieving and biting tongues.

title: A proposed bill in Florida would ban dogs from hanging their heads out of car windows
description: Dogs would not be able to hang their heads out of car windows under a new bill proposed in Florida. The bill would additionally ban cat declawing and cosmetic animal testing.

title: An Australian man pleads guilty to manslaughter in death of a gay American in 1988
description: Scott White's admission in the New South Wales state Supreme Court comes three months after he had his conviction for murdering Scott Johnson overturned by an appeals court.

title: No cow needed: Oat and soy can be called milk, FDA proposes
description: Food and Drug Administration officials have issued guidance that says plant-based beverages don't pretend to be from dairy animals – and that U.S. consumers aren't confused by the difference.

title: A girl and a TV journalist were fatally shot near the scene of another shooting
description: Authorities in Florida don't immediately have a motive for any of the shootings. A TV crewmember and the girl's mother were also wounded and in critical condition at the hospital.

title: Unlikely alliances in Supreme Court opinions on overtime, death penalty
description: The cases involved who qualifies for overtime pay, and Arizona's refusal to apply a Supreme Court precedent in death penalty jury instructions.

title: Winter storm sending heavy snow where California rarely sees it
description: The winter storm that's pummeling nearly half the United States means snow in parts of California that often don't see it.
